sports_innovation_journal.description: Open-access scholarly journal focused on practitioner-oriented research.
sports_innovation_journal.mission: To create an ongoing culture of collaboration between researchers and practitioners in every aspect of the sports industry, focusing on research that informs the development of innovative ideas.
sports_innovation_journal.editorial_board: Composed of researchers and practitioners in various disciplines within college and professional sports.

author_submission_guidelines.problem_background_methods_results_impli: Manuscript must clearly indicate the problem, provide background, describe methods, explain results, and describe implications for the sports industry.
author_submission_guidelines.no_prior_publication: Submission has not been previously published nor is under consideration elsewhere.
author_submission_guidelines.format: Single-spaced Microsoft Word document, 12-point font, italics for emphasis (except URLs), illustrations/figures/tables within the text.
author_submission_guidelines.data_availability: If applicable, data can be made available in Tableau.
author_submission_guidelines.abstract_keywords: Abstract between 150-200 words, manuscript less than 4,000 words, includes relevant keywords.
author_submission_guidelines.apa_style: Text adheres to the latest edition of the “Publication Manual of the American Psychological Association.”

sports_innovation_journal.infographics: The Sports Innovation Institute will supply infographic material for approved submissions.
sports_innovation_journal.podcast_tie_ins: Podcast episodes often feature discussions related to journal articles.

podcast.description: The Sports Innovation Podcast episodes featuring Dr. Liz Wanless, engaged-learning special issues, youth sports transformation, industry accelerator insights, NFTs in sports, and more.
